item.description:
Title
TPNO Boston / New England Chapter Launch Financial Empowerment Series

When
Friday, October 23, 2009 3:00 PM

Members can RSVP until

Wednesday, October 21, 2009 3:00 PM

Details

We will be collaborating with Shanita Williamson and the The Boston Black Professionals Meetup Group.


Anthony "Tony" Herbert, Chairman/Founder-CEO and Luis Vaz, National Network President will talk about the history of the Professionals Network Organization that was first established in 1996 and its expansion to Boston.


Speaker: Teresa R Martin, Esq.

Teresa R Martin, principal of Law Offices of Teresa R Martin, P.C. (www.martinlegal.com) and Qualified Field Trainer for United Credit Education Services, concentrates her practice in the areas of real estate, foreclosure defense and credit restoration services. Ms. Martin is a seasoned real estate investor with over 54 investment properties and a licensed real estate broker. Ms. Martin has experience in lender liability defense, real estate title clearance and litigation, real estate foreclosure, mortgage fraud civil prosecution and defense, loss mitigation involving mortgage fraud and other lending related issues, review and creation of lending documents. She is a frequent speaker regarding mortgage lending and servicing issues, wills & trusts as well as credit restoration services. She is also called upon for training regarding mortgage originating and closing issues for clients, real estate investorâ€™s associations, churches, as well as community organizations.


Mr. Cliff Martin

Cliff Martin of Web Credit Advisors will do a presentation on debt settlement. Unlike other companies that collect their entire fee in the first six months Web Credit Advisors spreads your payments over the time you are in the program whether it's 12, 24, or 36 months. They are unique in handling claims, removing liens, and garnishments. Other companies do not. They also offer clients a free self help guide to on how do negotiate debt.


We are facing tough economic times so this event is for folks who are interested in learning more about staying financially fit in a tough economy. Individuals who are also in real-estate and banking are also encouraged to attend.

We will also have raffle giveaways !!!! Special Guest Charles Clemons, General Manager of Touch 106.1 FM The one and only black owned radio station in Boston !!!

Where

Vlora Restaurant
545 Boylston St
Boston, MA 02116
617- 638 -9699

Who's organizing?
cliff martin, Filaine Deronette, Joanne Skerrett, Qiana Christian, Robert Omoyeni, Shanita Williamson, and Teresa R Martin, Esq.
Ask your members questions when they RSVP
What do you know about the importance of good credit?
item.name: TPNO Boston / New England Chapter Launch Financial Empowerment Series
